text: I’m 27. I graduated from a technical university as a civil engineer. I like to design and create construction drawings. But one day I tried to write a simple JavaScript program and I couldn't stop. In my opinion, programming is a conditional design of "buildings", "cities", but it differs only in the implementation of the finished product. For example, microservices are created as “buildings” with their own internal infrastructure.

The more I learn JavaCript the more I like it, and amaze me. It gets a lot of interesting and cool features every year. For this reason, it pleases developers and new adherents of this programming language who want to feel its power :)

At the moment I am interested front-end (little back-end), but in the future I want to move on to back-end development. At the same time, it's a wish to try other server-side development languages (Java or Go).
There is a lot of interest in the Linux ecosystem and technical innovations. Most of all I regret that there are 24 hours in a day...

list.name: EPAM Systems
description: EPAM Systems, Inc. is an American company that specializes in product development, digital platform engineering, and digital and product design. The world's largest manufacturer of custom software, consulting specialist, resident of the Belarus High Technologies Park. The company's headquarters is located in Newtown, Pennsylvania, and its branches are represented in more than 30 countries of the world

list.name: The Rolling Scopes School (Node.js)
description: RS School the free courses conducted by The Rolling Scopes developer community since 2013. Developers from different companies and countries participate in the training.
